greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ways to write 2n-1 as the sum of a Sophie Germain prime and a practical number.
comment: This has been verified for n up to 5*10^6.
link: Zhi-Wei Sun, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Zhi-Wei Sun, Conjectures involving primes and quadratic forms, arxiv:1211.1588 [math.NT], 2012-2017
example: a(40)=1 since 2*40-1=23+56 with 23 a Sophie Germain prime and 56 a practical number.
results.author: _Zhi-Wei Sun_, Jan 14 2013
